NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Beauty and Online or the cell corresponding to Pet Supplies and Online?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Beauty} and {Online} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Apparel and Brick&Mortar or the cell corresponding to Jewelry and Brick&Mortar?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Apparel} and {Brick&Mortar} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Pet Supplies and Omnichannel or the cell corresponding to Apparel and Online?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Apparel} and {Online} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Beauty and Marketplace or the cell corresponding to Sports and Online?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Sports} and {Online} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.49 to 0.58?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Apparel, Omnichannel), (Books, Omnichannel), (Jewelry, Omnichannel), (Pet Supplies, Omnichannel), (Sports, Omnichannel), (Toys, Omnichannel)}.
